intro: Engelia tovarensis, commonly known as the Tovarensis mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it typically grows in rocky or coastal areas. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
